oai_dc:dc.dc:title: General John C. Breckinridge

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Military uniforms
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Breckinridge, John C. (John Cabell), 1821-1875
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bust portrait of General John C. Breckinridge in uniform.

John C. Breckinridge, born in Kentucky in 1821, practiced law before being elected U.S. Representative in 1855. In 1857, he became vice president under James Buchanon and, in 1861, was elected U.S. senator. He served in the Mexcan-American War and was a major general in the Confederate Army during the Civil War, where he served at Stones River, Chickamauga, and Chattanooga. In 1865, Breckinridge served as the Confederate secretary of war. He died in 1875.
